Iuran BPJS Kesehatan Naik, IDI Sebut Pelayanan Kesehatan Belum Tentu Semakin Baik
02 Nov 2019, 18:09 by Sugandi Afandi


Iuran BPJS Kesehatan Naik, IDI Sebut Pelayanan Kesehatan Belum Tentu Semakin Baik

KBRN, Jakarta:  Kenaikan iuran Jaminan Kesehatan Nasional (JKN) program  Badan Penyelenggara  Jaminan Sosial (BPJS), tidak serta merta akan membuat pelayanan kesehatan semakin menjadi lebih baik jika  kenaikan iuran hanya untuk menutupi defisit .
Wakil Ketua Umum 1 Pengurus Besar  Dokter Indonesia (PB IDI) Dr. Moh Adib Khumaidi mengatakan bicara pelayanan kesehatan, tidak hanya sekedar menyangkut menaikan iuran tetapi terkait komponen lain seperti aturan, institusi.
“Permasalahan JKN adalah permasalahan didalam rules, structure dan institusinya. Saya kira kenaikan iuran ini tidak serta merta akan berdampak kepada pelayanan. Saya masih belum bisa mengatakan berdampak kepada kualitas pelayanan yang baik,” kata Moh Adib Khumaidi, dalam diskusi di Jakarta, Sabtu (2/11/2019).
IDI khawatir apabila hanya menaikan iuran untuk menutupi defisit, persoalan ini akan muncul dimasa mendatang. Terkesan ‘Gali lubang tutup lubang’.
“Saya harapkan perbaikan. Kalau ada kenaikan, tidak hanya menutup defisit saja tetapi kepada kualitas pelayanan. Konsep diawal kalau sekarang dikedepankan defisit, kemudian ada kenaikan,  kita takutkan hanya menutupi defisit saja. Kalau hanya menutup defisit, analisa kita sampai akhir Desember Rp 28 triliun, kalau menutup Rp 10 triliun, masih ada Rp 18 triliun belum ditutup. Nanti sama saja gali lubang tutup lubang,” terangnya.
Oleh sebab itu menurutnya seluruh defisit dituntaskan.
“Kalau masuk daru awal ditutup semua, re-desain JKN . Kita perbaiki JKN, kita siapkan JKN,” terangnya. (sgd

BPJS Health Contributions Go Up, IDI Calling Health Services Not Necessarily Getting Better
02 Nov 2019, 18:09 by Sugandi Afandi


BPJS Health Contributions Go Up, IDI Calling Health Services Not Necessarily Getting Better

KBRN, Jakarta: The increase in the contribution of the National Health Insurance (JKN) program of the Social Security Organizing Agency (BPJS) will not necessarily make health services even better if the contribution increase is only to cover the deficit.
Deputy Chairperson 1 of the Indonesian Physician Board (PB IDI) Dr. Moh Adib Khumaidi said that talking about health services is not just about raising fees but related to other components such as rules and institutions.
"The problem of JKN is a problem in the rules, structure and institutions. I do not think this increase in fees will necessarily have an impact on service. I still can't say it has an impact on good service quality, "said Moh Adib Khumaidi, in a discussion in Jakarta, Saturday (11/02/2019).
IDI is worried that if it only raises dues to cover the deficit, this problem will arise in the future. Impressed ‘Dig a hole close a hole’.
"I expect improvement. If there is an increase, it will not only cover the deficit but also the quality of service. The concept of the beginning is that if the current deficit is prioritized, then there is an increase, we are afraid only to cover the deficit. If we only cover the deficit, our analysis until the end of December is IDR 28 trillion, if we close IDR 10 trillion, there will still be IDR 18 trillion not covered. Later, it will be the same as digging the hole, "he explained.
Therefore, according to him, the entire deficit was resolved.
"If everything is entered from the beginning, everything will be closed, re-design JKN. We fix JKN, we prepare JKN, "he explained. (sgd
